QuestionJSON.Question: Chile is working on a project to analyze customer reviews from an e-commerce website for a market research. They have access to a library that can scrape reviews from websites, and another library that can perform sentiment analysis on text. How can Chile remix these components to create a new program that not only fetches reviews but also analyzes sentiment?
QuestionJSON.Answer1: Create a new program that uses the scraping library to fetch reviews, then input each review into the sentiment analysis library.
QuestionJSON.Answer2: Create two separate programs: one for scraping reviews and the other for sentiment analysis.
QuestionJSON.Answer3: Run the sentiment analysis library on the whole website instead of individual reviews.
QuestionJSON.Answer4: Use the scraping library to fetch reviews and print them, without any sentiment analysis.
QuestionJSON.Explanation: The concept of remixing in coding involves constructing new programs by reusing and re-configuring existing blocks of code. Chile can create a new, single program that imports and utilizes both the scraping library and the sentiment analysis library to achieve the desired result. This is a more efficient solution than creating two separate programs or ignoring the sentiment analysis entirely.
